page.title: 04MY CLASSROOM AT ALVES P.S.
page.content: At Alves Primary School P.6 and P.7 are in a classroom together, taught by Mr. Holland who is also the Headteacher. We all sit at tables in groups of at least four people. All around the classroom on the walls are pictures and poems that we have made. Each term we make a large frieze about our project. This stretches right across one of the classroom walls. These pictures improve the classroom's appearance, but dispite this, it still has disadvantages. As the school has recently been made open plan it seems to be very noisy. We can also hear cars and lorries whizzing past on the A96. The most annoying thing is hearing aeroplanes from RAF Kinloss and Lossiemouth flying past directly overhead, just as Mr. Holland is trying to explain something.
